    Topwave¶

    Topwave is a library is composed of the following modules:

    coupling¶

    class topwave.coupling.Coupling(index: int, lattice_vector: ~numpy.ndarray[~typing.Any, ~numpy.dtype[~numpy.int64]], site1: ~pymatgen.core.sites.PeriodicSite, orbital1: int, site2: ~pymatgen.core.sites.PeriodicSite, orbital2: int, symmetry_id: int, symmetry_op: ~pymatgen.core.operations.SymmOp, is_set: bool = False, spin_orbit: ~numpy.ndarray[~typing.Any, ~numpy.dtype[~numpy.float64]] = <factory>, strength: float = 0.0)[source]¶

    Coupling of two sites.

    Examples

    Group¶

    coupling

    distance: float¶
    get_energy() → float[source]¶

    Returns the classical energy of the coupling.

    get_exchange_matrix() → ndarray[source]¶

    Returns the exchange matrix.

    get_fourier_coefficients(k_point: _SupportsArray[dtype] | _NestedSequence[_SupportsArray[dtype]] | bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes | _NestedSequence[bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes]) → tuple[complex, numpy.ndarray[Any, numpy.dtype[numpy.complex128]]][source]¶

    Returns the Fourier coefficient and its inner derivatives at k_point.

    get_spin_orbit_matrix_elements(k_point: _SupportsArray[dtype] | _NestedSequence[_SupportsArray[dtype]] | bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes | _NestedSequence[bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes]) → tuple[numpy.ndarray[Any, numpy.dtype[numpy.complex128]], numpy.ndarray[Any, numpy.dtype[numpy.complex128]]][source]¶

    Creates the matrix elements of the tight-binding Hamiltonian that come from spin-orbit interation.

    get_spinwave_matrix_elements(k_point: _SupportsArray[dtype] | _NestedSequence[_SupportsArray[dtype]] | bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes | _NestedSequence[bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes]) → tuple[complex, complex, complex, complex, complex, complex, numpy.ndarray][source]¶

    Constructs the matrix elements for the Spinwave Hamiltonian at a given k-point.

    get_tightbinding_matrix_elements(k_point: _SupportsArray[dtype] | _NestedSequence[_SupportsArray[dtype]] | bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes | _NestedSequence[bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes]) → tuple[complex, numpy.ndarray[Any, numpy.dtype[numpy.complex128]]][source]¶

    Constructs the matrix elements for the TightBinding Hamiltonian at a given k-point.

    index: int¶
    is_set: bool¶
    lattice_vector: ndarray[Any, dtype[int64]]¶
    orbital1: int¶
    orbital2: int¶
    set_coupling(strength: float) → None[source]¶

    Sets the couplings.

    set_spin_orbit(vector: list[float] | ndarray[Any, dtype[float64]], strength: float = None) → None[source]¶

    Sets the spin-orbit coupling.

    site1: PeriodicSite¶
    site2: PeriodicSite¶
    spin_orbit: ndarray[Any, dtype[float64]]¶
    strength: float¶
    sublattice_vector: ndarray[Any, dtype[float64]]¶
    symmetry_id: int¶
    symmetry_op: SymmOp¶
    unset() → None[source]¶

    Sets strength and spin_orbit coupling to zero and unsets itself.

    model¶

    class topwave.model.Model(structure: Structure, import_site_properties: bool = False)[source]¶

    Base class that contains the physical model.

    delete_all_couplings() → None[source]¶

    Deletes all couplings.

    generate_couplings(max_distance: float, space_group: int) → None[source]¶

    Generates couplings up to a distance and groups them based on the spacegroup.

    get_couplings(attribute: str, value: int | float) → list[topwave.coupling.Coupling][source]¶

    Returns couplings selected by some attribute

    get_set_couplings() → list[topwave.coupling.Coupling][source]¶

    Returns couplings that have been assigned some exchange.

    abstract get_type() → str[source]¶

    Returns the type of the model.

    invert_coupling(index: int) → None[source]¶

    Inverts the orientation of a coupling.

    set_coupling(attribute_value: int | float, strength: float, attribute: str = 'index') → None[source]¶

    Assigns (scalar) hopping/exchange to a selection of couplings.

    set_moments(orientations: list[Union[numpy._typing._array_like._SupportsArray[numpy.dtype], numpy._typing._nested_sequence._NestedSequence[numpy._typing._array_like._SupportsArray[numpy.dtype]], bool, int, float, complex, str, bytes, numpy._typing._nested_sequence._NestedSequence[Union[bool, int, float, complex, str, bytes]]]], magnitudes: list[float] = None) → None[source]¶

    Sets the magnetic moments on each site of the structure given in lattice coordinates.

    set_onsite_scalar(index: int, strength: float, space_group: int = 1) → None[source]¶

    Sets a scalar onsite energy to a given site.

    set_onsite_vector(index: int, vector: list[float] | ndarray[Any, dtype[float64]], strength: float = None, space_group: int = 1) → None[source]¶

    Sets a local Zeeman field/single-ion anisotropy to a given site.

    set_open_boundaries(direction: str = 'xyz') → None[source]¶

    Sets the exchange/hopping and DM/SOC at the chosen boundary to zero.

    set_spin_orbit(attribute_value: int | float, vector: list[float] | ndarray[Any, dtype[float64]], strength: float = None, attribute: str = 'index') → None[source]¶

    Assigns spin dependent hopping/DM exchange to a selection of couplings.

    set_zeeman(orientation: list[float] | ndarray[Any, dtype[float64]], strength: float = None) → None[source]¶

    Sets a global Zeeman term.

    show_couplings() → None[source]¶

    Prints the couplings.

    show_site_properties() → None[source]¶

    Prints the site properties.

    unset_coupling(attribute_value: int | float, attribute: str = 'index') → None[source]¶

    Removes exchanges from a coupling and makes it unset.

    unset_moments()[source]¶

    Unsets all magnetic moments of the structure.

    write_cif(path: str, write_magmoms: bool = True) → None[source]¶

    Saves the structure to a .mcif file.

    class topwave.model.SpinWaveModel(structure: Structure, import_site_properties: bool = False)[source]¶

    Class for Spinwave models.

    Examples

    lolol

    Group¶

    model

    get_classical_energy(per_spin: bool = True) → float[source]¶

    Computes the classical ground state energy of the model.

    get_classical_groundstate(random_init=False)[source]¶

    Minimize the classical energy by changing the orientation of the magnetic moments.

    get_type() → str[source]¶

    Overrides the ‘get_type’-method to return the spinwave type.

    set_single_ion_anisotropy(index: int, vector: list[float] | ndarray[Any, dtype[float64]], strength: float = None, space_group: int = 1) → None[source]¶

    Assigns single-ion anisotropy to a given site (same as ‘set_onsite_vector’-method).

    class topwave.model.TightBindingModel(structure: Structure, import_site_properties: bool = False)[source]¶

    Child class of Model for Tight-Binding models.

    check_if_spinful()[source]¶

    Checks whether the model is spinful or spinless (polarized).

    get_type() → str[source]¶

    Overrides the ‘get_type’-method to return the tightbinding type.

    set_orbitals(index: int, num_orbitals: int)[source]¶

    Sets the number of orbitals on a given site.
